intro: Agrestis alba, commonly known as white agrimony, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers, which range from white to pale yellow, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators. Agrestis alba is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
